newsitem.title: USA: Vitro SA's Anchor Glass unit files for Chapter 11.
newsitem.headline: Vitro SA's Anchor Glass unit files for Chapter 11.

text.p: Anchor Glass Container Corp, a subsidiary of Vitro SA, on Friday filed for Chapter 11 protection in the U.S. Bankruptcy Court in Delaware.
In court papers, Anchor listed assets of $1.2 billion and liabilities of $951.1 million.
The voting securities of Anchor, based in Tampa, Fla., are 100 percent owned by Container Holding Corp, a direct subsidiary of Vitro, a Mexican limited liability company.

Among the largest unsecured creditors are Chase Manhattan Bank, with $200 million in 9.875 percent senior subordinated notes due 2008; and Bank of America, with $100 million in 10.25 senior notes, series A due 2002, court papers say.
A Vitro official in Mexico City said on Monday that the company expected to have a buyer for Anchor "later this month."
Anchor, the third-largest U.S. glass container company, has been offered for sale since June., the report says.
